title: cmd/godoc: Analysis failed (cmd)
body:
What does 'go version' print?

go version go1.3.1 linux/amd64

What steps reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.

1. install godoc from source
2. run godoc -http=:8080 -analysis="type"

What happened?

2014/09/18 17:49:15 Analysis failed: cannot find package "cmd" in any of:
	/home/pierre/Go/go/src/pkg/cmd (from $GOROOT)
	/home/pierre/Go/src/cmd (from $GOPATH).



("cmd" path is /home/pierre/Go/go/src/cmd, not /home/pierre/Go/go/src/pkg/cmd)

What should have happened instead?

Analysis should run.

Please provide any additional information below.

➜  ~  echo $GOPATH
/home/pierre/Go

➜  ~  echo $GOROOT


➜  ~  ls $GOPATH
bin  go  pkg  src

➜  ~  go env
GOARCH="amd64"
GOBIN=""
GOCHAR="6"
GOEXE=""
GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
GOHOSTOS="linux"
GOOS="linux"
GOPATH="/home/pierre/Go"
GORACE=""
GOROOT="/home/pierre/Go/go"
GOTOOLDIR="/home/pierre/Go/go/pkg/tool/linux_amd64"
CC="gcc"
GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m64 -pthread -fmessage-length=0"
CXX="g++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"
